lines.text: All I know is there's a straight jacket waiting on you with your number.
Sometimes when you're on the outside looking in you see some things other people can't.
When you consider that you get older every single day when you wake up, it can tempt one to rush into decisions a little!

You know what a glove man is? I'm a glove man. You shag flies in the hot sun all your life, but you never go to bat. Like right off, they said - no parents, make him an orphan - he'll be alright. Education? Grammer school's enough; send him off to work. So I cooperate, & then they come up with a nice big Depression.
It's a fine thing. Minute a fella's back is turned, you hang up curtains.
Uh, they take up the oxygen.
Eh, your picture in life, and maybe get a new suit; a lot of hullabaloo. And one day I'm walkin' down the street and around the corner comes a bolt of lightning. POW! D-E-D. Dead.
I always end up at the bottom of the pile.
It's homes like these that are the backbone of the nation. Where's the spinning wheel?

[walking in on the girls calmly setting the table]
Something's wrong here.
How about the big build up you were gonna give me?
Oh, aren't you gonna mention my talent? We talked about it all the way home, remember?
All they have to do is look at you to know you have no talent.
